title: Beautiful Steak
text:
Very nice cosy place nice atmosphere. Waitress was wonderful (shame can't remember her name) very happy smiley lady.
Speed of service was excellent.
Both meals were well presented, nice and hot and the steak was perfect.
Highly suggest a visit.

title: Wonderful Delight
text:
Dropped in at 12.30pm on the off chance for lunch. Very busy but got a nice table.
Introduction & service at reception a bit slow but polite.
The downside first: The tables have been laid out to really use the space and you could feel slightly clostrphobic and shut in. It was awkward getting to our table amongst many people. Even the waitress had problems getting us to the table.
The Upside: The food was wonderful. Fresh and tasty with a very good selection catering for varied taste buds.
The Biggest Upside was our waitress Renae: What a refreshingly delightful lady to have serve you. She was fantastic. Polite, funny, engaging and knew her job so very well. We would go back here again just to receive her delightful service.
Overall a nice experience and a great place to go if alone or with friends for good food at very reasonable cost.
Highly recommend.

title: Wonderful
text:
Brilliant place to pay your respects to the many fallen men.
Be prepared for some tiring climbs if you visit some of the out of the way cemeteries, but most are easy to find with easy access.
Most difficult part of visiting is finding safe places to park if you have your own transport as the roads are not that wide with quite steep angled drop offs on both sides.

Regards
Adrian & Anna (NZ)

title: Somewhat disappointed
text:
Yes it has the history, the stories, the uniforms etc, but unfortunately it feels sterile.
A bunch of exhibits grouped in glass containers.
You dont really feel you are getting the story.
Its a shame.
The staff were not pleasant, very cold and not open and willing to come forward in a helpful manner.

title: Amazing
text:
What a most beautiful Hotel.
The front desk staff were so very helpful with very good understanding of english.
The dinning staff were so pleasant & interested in finding out where we were from & how we liked their country.
The doormen went above helpful when we needed transport, arranging taxis and fares for us before the taxi even arrived.
The room was so well laid out, most very comfortable bed, superb furniture with a wonderful shower.
More than we could have hoped for.

title: Most comfortable
text:
A lovely well presented room, with excellent views over Picton & the harbour and what an extremely large floor space. One of the largest rooms we have ever had any hotel.
Very comfy bed, with jug & fridge in the room & a good heater.
Nice polite staff.
The breakfast was amazingly huge :-)
Beautiful bacon, sausages, mushrooms, eggs, baked beans, tomatoes and toast, what a way to start the day and the dinning room staff were so very good.

title: The Graveyard set for the movie- The Frighteners
text:
On a steep hill overlooking the beautiful harbour of Lyttleton is the graveyard that was used as the set in the movie The Frighteners, starring Micheal J Fox.
Back then the cemetery was well looked after, but now after the earthquakes that struck the Canterbury region the cemetery is now run down.
Many of the head stones have been displaced or fallen down & broken, concrete that once enclosed graves has been displaced and broken away.
Such a dreadful shame for a place that houses much history.

title: Wonderful History
text:
The most amazing place to visit that is FREE !!!
The utmost respect for all the people who have put in their valuable time & effort to restore all the aircraft & memorabilia that is here to enjoy.
The volunteer staff are great, willing to answer questions & give a description & history of the museum & aircraft.
Definately a must see in Christchurch
place: Air Force Museum of New Zealand

title: Most Tasteful Food
text:
Warm & inviting, lovely decor.
Our first of what we believe to be many more wonderful visits to Francesca's.
The staff were warm, hospitable & very help.
The food was above expectations for a first visit.
The wife totally enjoyed her pasta which she said tasted amazing.
I had the best Pizza in New Zealand, even better than those I have tried in Italy.
A must visit when deciding to dine out in Christchurch.

title: Fantastic
text:
The plane was nice and clean the seats very comfortable with good leg space.
The aircraft A320.
Outbound journey, late morning,
Return leg, mid afternoon.
On time departures both sectors with on time arrivals.
Check in staff at both airports FANTASTIC. they could not have been more helpful and pleasant.
Cabin crew on both directions wonderful, cheerful, smiling and polite.
I did however feel sorry for them with a full passenger load in both directions and such a short flight time to deliver a very nice toasted Ham & Cheese sandwich then clean up before the approaches.
It was a credit to them how they coped.
Highly recommend flying Turkish internally to anyone.

Regards
Adrian & Anna

title: Breath taking
text:
Probably the most peaceful place we have ever visited. The overwhelming feeling of peace is amazing, if only the rest of the world could feel this way.
The devastation here from the past ( for all sides concerned) is dreadful, but to come here and honour all these men (Husbands, fathers, sons, brothers) without dwelling on the circumstances is something very special.
The way in which the many cemeteries are kept is a credit to those concerned.
While there is nothing we could complain/moan about, our only disappointment was the extremely large lack of memorabilia related to our New Zealand participation.
If ever in Turkey, please make an effort to visit the protected sacred site.

title: Average
text:
Unfortunately disappointed with the museum.
Personally thought a little one sided with exhibits and the number of exhibits for such a large and beautiful building.

Adrian & Anna (NZ)

title: A breath of fresh air
text:
To find a hotel that puts a smile on your face is a rare thing in this day and age.
TJ and his staff have made our 4 week holiday a time to remember.
They are more than staff, they make you feel like a family.
Their interaction with visitors is overwhelming, they care but more than that it is genuine.
No Kiwi or Ozzie should go past staying at TJs Hotel when visiting Galipolli.
Inside the hotel you find many historic books and guides for the battlefields & cemeteries along with pictures and memorabilia from that great war.
If you can't find a certain place just ask TJ. If he doesn't know it's location it doesn't igsist.
Look no further for somewhere to stay in Eceabat, you have found it.

Thank you to the whole family at TJs for such a wonderful stay.
We will remember you all as you do a family member.

Regards
Adrian & Anna (NZ)
place: TJ's Anzac Gallipoli Tours - Day Tours

title: Busy
text:
Plenty to see and do and more than enough shops to keep you spending for days with great bargains.
Beware of the trams when walking around they run very close to the narrow footpaths.

Adrian & Anna (NZ)

title: Nice
text:
Loads of people, quite a long queue and waiting time to get into the Mosque.
Under renovations at this time but a beautiful and very peaceful place to visit.
For the Mosque my biggest concern was the lack of respect by the tourist public walking amongst those praying on the prayer floor and taking photos of the woman praying in the woman's area. Highly disrespectful I thought.

beware outside the Mosque are nice gentlemen who want to help and guide you through the entry process but only for you to emerge and there they are waiting for you enticing you to visit family stores nearby. Saying no seems to have no effect and you could feel highly pressured but turn a deaf ear and walk briskly toward a large group of people (even if you don't know them) and these creeps will then back away.

Take care!

Regards
Adrian & Anna (NZ)

title: Most beautiful Steak
text:
Situated on a side street opposite the railway station and between KFC & Burger King is the place for an amazing steak in Istanbul.
Cooked to perfection.
Great choice of different steaks available too.
Overall a brilliant menu on offer with good friendly, smiling, helpful staff.
Indoor or outdoor tables.
Great service & great food.
Highly recommend.

Regards
Adrian & Anna (NZ)

title: Fantastic
text:
Apart from the food being good, the staff are the most amazing in France.
I only wish I could remember the waiters name that looked after us with such superb style, manners and take the time to chat with us.
It was our first experience in France where the staff have smiled, laughed with us and taken the time to speak.
You must try this restaurant whether you ate staying at the hotel or not.

Regards
Adrian &Anna (NZ)

title: Nice
text:
Good hotel, nice and handy to Nice Airport, in fact a 5min walk to terminal one where you can also get the shuttle to terminal 2.
Comfortable and clean with a great bath.
The restaurant was good with good food but the staff were amazing.
So helpful cheerful, smiling and took the time to chat with you. This was a first for us in France and it sold the hotel to us.
Would highly recommend this hotel.

Regards
Adrian & Anna (NZ)
place: Park Inn by Radisson Nice Airport Hotel

title: Worth It
text:
With the history associated with the island this is a must do.
Enjoyable short boat ride, approx 20mins.
The booking process is very easy but make sure you get there early in the morning to avoid the queues should you decide to go in the morning, the office opens at 8.30am.
The castle itself is fascinating.
History beyond the book and movie is unreal.
Be prepared for a couple of narrow stair wells, other than that easy to get around.
Great 360 degree views around the island and of Marseilles and it's coastline.
Nice little cafe and VERY clean rest rooms.
NOTE; please ensure you are ready to get off quickly at Chateau d'if as the boat ties up very fast and departs just as quick it doesn't hang around.
Also note there are sometimes when 2 boats are operating so please check which boat stops at the Chateau first.

Regards
Adrian & Anna (NZ)

title: Lovely
text:
A lovely old church but some how a very cold atmosphere inside, maybe the lack of lighting inside probably adds to this.
Great history inside regarding the church and it's associated Saints, including one buried inside at the head of the church.

Regards
Adrian & Anna (NZ)

title: Lovely
text:
Nice water front, busy yet relaxing.
Wide variety of places to eat and drink either inside or outside.
Easy to get to and get around with bus services available directly at the water front along with the Metro and the Tram system a 5 min walk away.

title: The walk is worth it
text:
A beautiful Church with a hell of a walk to enjoy the interior of the church and the all round views of the city of Marseilles.
The steps up will try the best of us but we'll worth it.
We went via the hop-on hop-off bus but the Number 60 bus from the harbour will also take you there directly.
Nice little cafe, souvenir and museum also on site.
A must see when in Marseilles.

Regards
Adrian & Anna (NZ)
place: Basilique Notre Dame de la Garde

title: Inspiring
text:
What a beautiful piece of architecture.
Stunning both inside and out.
This cathedral is not only for the religious people but for all people no matter your religion.

Adrian & Anna (NZ)

title: Unbelievable service
text:
Booked 2 trips via email.
Confirmation within mins followed by reminder email the day before pick-up.
They were there waiting at the required time, polite and helpful drivers.
Fantastic service.
And Antonio, you are the man for all your help and very fast return emails
5 Star service

Adrian & Anna (NZ)

title: First time impressed
text:
Very smooth check-in procedure no hassles.
On time boarding.
Plane an A320 very clean.
Cabin crew pleasant but not overly eager.
A very good economical airline to fly with good timings.

Regards
Adrian & Anna (NZ)

title: Nice Old Fashioned English Pub
text:
A nice old fashioned pub.
Obviously very popular as it was quite busy.
Good choice for the Roast meal, lamb,beef,chicken and pork although the pork is simply a pork chop, coupled with a good sized portion of mixed veg and mashed and baked potatoes.
Price was good and service OK but friendly.
On the down side potatoes and veg nice and hot the meat however slightly on the cold side but a very filling meal.

Regards
Adrian & Anna (NZ)

title: The best Steak in Malaga
text:
After looking for a good a steak we finally found it.
Napolitan BBQ does a first class steak that would give a good restaurant back home a race for top steak.
Cooked to perfection it just melted in the mouth.
Service was brilliant very friendly staff who smiled and made us feel welcome.
We would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone travelling to Malaga.

Regards
Adrian & Anna (NZ)

title: Fantastic train
text:
Valencia to Malaga trip. Left precisely on time.
Very comfortable seating and so very smooth, you couldn't spill a drink on this train.
At one point we reached 300kph and you would not have known it if it weren't for the speed meter in your carriage.
Nice buffet car for drinks and nibbles reasonable priced.
The change of trains at Cordoba was so easy, off the train on one side of the platform and a short wait of a few mins and the AVE to Malaga was on the opposite side, no hassles of changing platforms.
Overall a great service at reasonable cost IF YOU BOOK EARLY enough on line.

Regards
Adrian & Anna (NZ)

title: Fabulous
text:
A very worth while way to see Valencia.
We spent the morning on the Blue route taking in the 'New'Valencia and the maritime, seaside area.
After a stretch of the legs and some lunch we did the 'Ted's route, the historic side of Valencia.
The on board commentary, via ear phones, was definitely of benefit giving good information as to what you were looking at.
The nudes were very comfortable, especially in the sunshine although the roof had to be covered in the afternoon because of rain but a very enjoyable day.
Highly recommend.

Regards
Adrian & Anna (NZ)

title: Amazing
text:
What a great atmosphere standing in the middle of the track or at the very top of the stand.
No matter where you are you soak up what once was and if you stand still long enough you can almost get the feeling you were there all those years ago.
An easy relaxing stroll from the city centre no need for nudes or taxis.

Regards
Adrian (NZ)

title: Well worth the walk
text:
A fantastic place to visit with the history and buildings surrounding this site.
It may be a climb, you may have to fight the wind and sand but don't let this put you off.
The view alone is worth the entry fee.
Regards
Adrian & Anna (New Zealand)

title: FANTASTIC
text:
The BEST place in Valencia for food taste & quality, price and hospitality.
The staff are amazing, even got to meet the owner.
Special thanks go to the following staff for friendliness above and beyond their worth:
Black & Decker 1 and 2
Mr Spanenglish
Mr Naples, and
Mr Brazil, you all know who you are.

They are entertaining, very delightful, very helpful and such wonderful hosts.
Go their and enjoy their unique hospitality and wonderful food.

Regards
Adrian & Anna (New Zealand)

title: Bad
text:
Return flight Auckland-Bangkok-Auckland.
Ground staff at Auckland and Bangkok great.
Cabin crew below average.
Plane-long haul legs AKL-HKG-AKL, A330. Showing their age very worn and both aircraft uncomfortable.
Meals again below average.
Short haul HKG-BKK-HKG again A330's in domestic layout and very untidy with wear and tear age related again very uncomfortable.
Meals, well no comment.
Cabin crew on all four sectors were well below average. No caring,no smiles, no general courtesy, more like a burden.
In fact the return long haul leg HKG-AKL the crew were not seen after collecting meal trays until 3 hours out of Auckland all looking remarkedly refreshed.
The so called breakfast was served at this time (strange) when arrival at Auckland was 3.15pm, but to mention breakfast, the scrambled egg was so watery it was unable to be picked up by fork if you could catch it that is.

Definitely an airline I would never recommend to anyone regardless of price. Pay the difference and fly Singapore or Thai where you get a wonderful experience.

Regards
Adrian & Anna (New Zealand)

title: Not too bad
text:
Flight Athens to Valencia via Rome. First time with Alitalia.
Ground staff at both airports Athens & Rome fantastic.
Cabin crews on both flights very ordinary no smiles, not out going in customer service really felt like a burden.
Snacks adequate for the 2 short flights.
Aircraft on both flights A320's clean tidy but felt very compact when comparing to other A320 flights.
Adrian & Anna (New Zealand)

title: Good
text:
Different Cabin crew as to our previous Korean Air flight, service was still good and very polite crew but the sincerity was not there this time.
Aircraft a fairly recent 787-9 clean tidy and comfortable.
Would still highly recommend Korean Air.
Adrian & Anna (New Zealand)

title: Wonderful Airlune
text:
Comfortable roomy seats even for Economy.
Highly efficient cabin crew very polite.
Nice food with good timings for the delivery of meals.
Airline service at Incheon for the layover was impeccable with staff guiding us all the way from assigning our coach right through to the arrival at the hotel.
Would very highly recommend Korean Air.
Adrian & Anna (New Zealand)

title: Great little hotel
text:
Fabulous location to everything Athens has to offer.
Small but comfortable rooms with very good shower and bath and lovely meals at the roof top restraunt with wonderful views of the Acropolis.
Staff wonderful, polite and extremely helpful.
Very close to the Metro too.
Adrian & Anna (New Zealand)

title: Fantastic
text:
Has to be rated the best hotel we have ever stayed at.
The service was impeccable.
The reception staff great but the men handling baggage etc were fantastic.
The food too amazing.
The room, the cleanest we have stayed in, roomy, light and inviting.
You can not go past this hotel.
Adrian & Anna (New Zealand)

title: Disgusting
text:
Booked many months in advance(June 2018) for this short flight with departure at 5.40pm in April 2019.
Late 2018 informed flight changed to 11.40am.
Jan 2019 flight changed to 9.45pm.
A week later flight again changed to 11.20pm.
March 2019 yet another change now to 11.35pm arriving 1.15am.
What a terrible way to run an airline.
The times have disrupted our holiday, not knowing when you are really travelling.
To make matters worse Iberia cannot be contacted via email unless you are a member of their loyalty club-pathetic.
Although the flight is run by subsidiary Air Nostrum, this still falls under the umbrella of Iberia who really needs to look at who they Code Share with.
We will certainly never be dealing with Iberia again, and having flown on many of the "Low Cost" airlines around the world particularly within Europe we have never experienced such a disgusting operating procedure.
Please people avoid sharing our problems and stay away from Iberia & Air Nostrum.
Regards Adrian

title: Paradise
text:
Anna and Adrian
We stayed at the resort for four days in Feb just gone, absolutely amazing place, went swimming nearly every day, enjoyed the Kayaks and being out in the water, the restaurant food was superb, the managers and staff interactions were really friendly and warm. We hired Sam (local taxi, transport guy) as recommended from the managers, he was excellent, really knowledgeable about Savai'i, took us all over the place and really explained place names and things like that, he was so cool. We highly recommend him to anyone who is looking at having a holiday at the Savai'i lagoon Resort.
